item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 6 Balance Changes—All Buffs & Nerfs
item.content:encoded:
A brand new season in Marvel Rivals has arrived with the launch of Season 6, and with it comes the usual balancing update full of fresh nerfs and buffs.

Season 6 of Marvel Rivals features many tweaks fans have long called for, along with an update to Team-Up Abilities. Some new ones have been added, whilst a couple have instead been removed.

If you’re looking for the full breakdown of nerfs and buffs coming alongside Season 6 of Marvel Rivals, then you’re in the right place—it’s all available below.

All Marvel Rivals Season 6 Buffs & Nerfs

Season 6 offers a large variety of balance changes, though the likes of Star-Lord and Hela manage to evade nerfs despite their OP nature.

A handful of Vanguards have seen some notable buffs, including the likes of Doctor Strange, Hulk and Emma Frost. Hulk has received a variety of cooldown improvements, whilst Doctor Strange has been given some movement adjustments to his Cloak of Levitation. Meanwhile, Angela is slightly easier to deal with, now that her shield value has dropped from 350 to 300.

Duelists have seen some hefty changes, too, with Black Panther and Iron Fist both receiving buffs. Diving the backline should be slightly easier now, thanks to some damage increases to some of their abilities. Blade has seen some tweaks, as you’ll need to choose between your weapons more carefully. Sadly, though, Daredevil is the main target for nerfs, as the Devil of Hell’s Kitchen was running riot last season.

Finally, the Strategists have come out the worst with Season 6’s balance changes, as the likes of Rocket Raccoon, Invisible Woman, and Gambit have all been nerfed. Rocket Raccoon has been slowed down slightly during his Wild Crawl, whilst Sue Storm’s Guardian Shield has dropped from 250 to 200 health. Gambit’s overall healing output has been lowered, as NetEase look to weaken his cards.

Full Marvel Rivals Version 20260116 Season 6 Balance Patch Notes

VANGUARD

Angela

We’re making it slightly easier to knock Angela out of the fray.
– Reduce Shielded Stance Shield Value from 350 to 300.

Captain America

It’s time for a little more star-spangled offense!
– Reduce Vibranium Energy Saw cooldown from 8s to 6s.

Doctor Strange

The Sorcerer Supreme is more agile and dangerous than ever!
– Increase the Maelstrom of Madness conversion ratio of Dark Magic to damage from 1.2 to 1.3.
– Cloak of Levitation New Effect: Re-casting during use now interrupts the ability, preserves current movement speed, and allows for new movement input to change trajectory.

Emma Frost

The White Queen’s energy gain gets a little more dazzling.
– Increase Energy gained:
Hero hits from 10/s to 12/s
Sentience hits from 15/s to 18/s
Shield hits from 5/s to 6/s

Hulk

Stronger than ever! Hulk’s survivability and threat level get a gamma boost!
– Reduce Hero Hulk Incredible Leap minimum charge time from 0.5s to 04s; maximum charge time from 2s to 1.7s.
– In Hero Hulk form, reduce Gamma Burst cooldown from 8s to 6s and increase projectile Damage from 70 to 75.
– In Monster Hulk form, Hulk is now immune to launch and knockback effects.

DUELIST

Black Panther

Wakanda forever! Panther’s offense and defense are slightly up!
– Increase Spear Toss Damage from 45 to 50.
– Gain 50% Damage Reduction during Bast’s Descent (Ultimate Ability) startup animation.

Blade

Daywalker’s threat level rises. Choose your weapon wisely!
– When wielding Hunter’s Shotgun, Daywalker Dash New Effect:
Slow enemies by 40% for 1.5s. Increase second hit damage from 20 to 50.
– When wielding Ancestral Sword, Daywalker Dash New Effect:
Remove Slow effect from enemies and apply 8% Healing Reduction per strike (32% total if all hit), for 3s. Reduce Damage from 15 to 8 per hit.
– Reduce pellets fired per round of Hunter’s Shotgun from 12 to 11. Damage falloff now starts at 15m (was 20m); at 30m, damage drops to 50% of base (was 40%).

Daredevil

The Devil of Hell’s Kitchen gets a little less punishing.
– Reduce Devil’s Chain high damage range Damage from 80 to 75.
– Reduce Devil’s Throw single Projectile Damage from 32.5 to 30 (total from 65 to 60 on a single target).
– Reduce Fury gained from Devil’s Latch when grappling a surface from 2 to 1.

Iron Fist

Lin Lie’s strikes are slightly faster and harder!
– Increase damage of Jeet Kune Do’s first four strikes from 30 to 35.
– Increase Dragon’s Defense maximum duration from 1s to 1.2s.

Namor

More power in his base form, but his Team-Up is toned down.
– Reduce Aquatic Dominion time for a single charge from 12s to 10s. 
– Increase default Monstro Spawn Health from 100 to 125 and Damage from 17 to 18.
– Increase Enhanced Monstro Spawn Damage from 11 to 12.

STRATEGIST

Cloak & Dagger

Ty and Tandy’s support is getting a shakeup, healing and flexibility updated!
– Reduce Dagger Storm Healing from 55/s to 45/s.
New Effect: When a Spell Field is created, allies in range get a One-Time Healing of 60.
– Veil of Lightforce & Terror Cape Adjustments:
These 2 abilities now share charges, capped out at 2 with each taking 10s to recharge. After using either, both abilities enter a 2s cooldown.

Gambit

The King of Cards takes a hit to his healing and ultimate.
– Reduce Big Easy Impact Healing Amount per explosion from 25 to 15 (total from 75 to 45).
– Reduce Ragin’ Royal Flush’s Healing from 75/s to 55/s.
– Bridge Boost bounces on a single target are now set to a maximum of 2.

Invisible Woman

Sue Storm is a little less unbreakable and her protection a little less potent.
– Reduce Guardian Shield value from 250 to 200.
– Reduce shield restoration rate after reclaiming from 42/s to 34/s (total time unchanged).
– Reduce Guardian Shield healing to Invisible Woman from 50/s to 25/s.

Rocket Raccoon

Rocket’s on a bit of a slow-down!
– Reduce Movement Speed during Wild Crawl from 10m/s to 8m/s.

TEAM-UP ABILITIES

BALANCE CHANGES

Deep Wrath (Hela – Namor)

No more tidal waves of pain. Namor’s team-up gets nerfed!
– Increase Tidal Dirge cooldown from 20s to 30s.
– Reduce Undead Monstro Damage from 12 to 10.
·Reduce Berserk state Undead Monstro Damage from 7 to 6.

Vibrant Vitality (Mantis – Groot/Loki)

Loki’s blessing is less overwhelming.
– Reduce Deific Blessing ally Damage Boost effect from 25% to 15%.

ADJUSTED OR REMOVED

Ever-Burning Bond (Human Torch – Spider-Man)

– This fiery partnership has been extinguished! Team-up removed!

Rocket Network (Rocket Raccoon – Peni Parker/Star-Lord)

– Peni Parker loses the Armored Spider-Nest ability she previously gained through her Team-Up with Rocket Raccoon.

NEW

Mr. Pool’s Interdimensional Toy Box (Deadpool – Jeff the Land Shark)

It’s a pocket universe of shenanigans!
– Jeff gains the Jeff’s Cuddle Buddy ability through his Team-Up with Deadpool.
– As the Team-Up Anchor, Deadpool gains:
Vanguard: +50 Health
Duelist: +5% Damage
Strategist: +5% Healing

Parker Power-Up (Peni Parker – Spider-Man)

Spiders stick together!
– Spider-Man unlocks the new Sticky Spider-Bomb ability through his team-up with Peni Parker.
– As the Team-Up Anchor, Peni Parker gains a Health increase of 50.

Take a look at the full details of the latest balance patch below, as shared on the official Marvel Rivals website.

Which characters do you think missed out on buffs or nerfs with Marvel Rivals Season 6? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Marvel Rivals, check out the Season 6 Roadmap.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 6 Roadmap—All Content Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Rivals Season 6 is here, and based on the Roadmap released by NetEase, it’s going to be a content-heavy season.

Of course, nobody needs a roadmap to know that the Merc with a Mouth is the latest hero to join the ever-growing Marvel Rivals roster. Deadpool will arrive with the launch of Season 6, but there’s much more to come than just a new character.

Check out the Marvel Rivals Season 6 Roadmap below, which details all of the upcoming content and when you can expect it to release.

All Marvel Rivals Season 6 Content & Roadmap

NetEase has revealed the Season 6 Roadmap for Marvel Rivals, which features a myriad of content, from new maps and heroes to skins and events.

Here’s the complete roadmap for Season 6:

January 16—Season 6 Release

  • New Hero: Deadpool
  • New Battle Pass: Museum Ticket
  • 9x New Skins
  • Hero Proficiency System Upgrade
  • New Team Ups: Parker Power Up & Mr Pool’s Interdimensional Toy Box
  • New Event: Whac-A-Jeff
  • New Accessories

January 23—Disco Night

  • 2x New Skins
  • Times Square Event: Disco Night

January 30—Clobberin’ Club

  • New Map: Museum of Contemplation
  • Times Square Expansion: The Clobberin’ Club
  • 2x New Skins
  • New Event: Flight Mode! World Tour Merch

February 2—Two New Looks

  • 2x New Skins

February 13—Season 6.5

  • Season 6.5 begins
  • New Hero: Elsa Bloodstone

Marvel Rivals Season 6 Content Dates & 6.5 News

Not too much is known about what you can expect from Marvel Rivals Season 6.5, but one thing is clear: Elsa Bloodstone is on the way.

NetEase has confirmed that Elsa Bloodstone will be the next playable hero in Marvel Rivals. She’ll be joining the roster on February 13, when Season 6.5 kicks into gear.

If you’re not familiar with who Else Bloodstone is, then don’t worry. She’s a relatively new figure in the Marvel universe, as she first appeared in Bloodstone #1 in 2001. Elsa is a British monster hunter who gains her powers from her father’s magical bloodstone choker.

As things stand, it’s unknown what her role will be in Marvel Rivals, but judging by her gun and sword combo, the odds are she will most likely arrive as a Duelist. Considering she hunts monsters for a living, she should have no trouble going toe-to-toe against the rest of the heroes.

Will you be jumping into Marvel Rivals Season 6? Share your thoughts on the new Season in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Marvel Rivals content, check out how you can buy and gift items directly from Discord.

item.title: 007 First Light Devs Update PC System Requirements After Big Blunder
item.content:encoded:
007 First Light devs have now released an updated set of PC System requirements after the community pointed out several errors.

IO Interactive’s next big title, 007 First Light, is all set to release on May 27, 2026, across all major platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, Switch 2, and PC. The title was initially set to release in March, but it was delayed late last year, providing the devs enough time to refine and polish the build. Check out the PC System requirements for 007 First Light below to see if your PC is capable of running the title.

Updated 007 First Light PC System Requirements

In a new post on X (formerly Twitter), the developers of 007 First Light have admitted there were a few “inconsistencies” in the previously released PC system requirements. The recommended RAM has been reduced to 16GB from 32GB, and the error in the minimum CPU line, which previously stated “Intel Core i5 9500K” (K being the issue), has been updated as well. The VRAM has also been reduced for both sets of requirements. Additional performance targets for the title will be shared closer to launch. Check out the updated set of PC system requirements for 007 First Light below:

Minimum:

  • Processor: Intel Core i5 9500 / AMD Ryzen 5 3500
  • Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1660 / AMD RX 5700 / Intel discrete GPU equivalent
  • RAM: 16 GB
  • Video RAM: 6 GB
  • Storage: 80 GB minimum
  • OS: Windows 10/11, 64-bit
  • Resolution: 1080p
  • FPS: 30

Recommended:

  • Processor: Intel Core i5 13500 / AMD Ryzen 5 7600
  • Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 Ti / AMD RX 6700 XT / Intel discrete GPU equivalent
  • RAM: 16 GB
  • Video RAM: 8 GB
  • Storage: 80 GB minimum
  • OS: Windows 10/11, 64-bit
  • Resolution: 1080p
  • FPS: 60

In other news, Lenny Kravitz is a villain in 007 First Light. What are your thoughts on the updated 007 First Light PC System Requirements? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Fortnite seemingly working on a Minecraft collaboration. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fortnite Rumored to Be Working on a Minecraft Collab
item.content:encoded:
A new rumor has emerged online suggesting that Fortnite may be collaborating with Minecraft.

Fortnite is a major player in the realm of collaborations within the gaming industry, partnering not only with various media franchises but also with different games. In the past, we have seen characters from iconic games such as God of War, Halo, Street Fighter, Resident Evil, and more appear in Fortnite. Now, it appears the devs may be collaborating with one of the largest games of all time, Minecraft.

Fortnite x Minecraft Seemingly in Early Development

The information about Fortnite’s Minecraft being in early development comes from X user (formerly Twitter) AdiraFNInfo, which was reposted by reliable Fortnite leaker HYPEX. However, HYPEX’s post has the word ‘rumored’ in it, which means that they haven’t been able to confirm whether this is indeed true. At the same time, if this is true, it could go down in the books as one of the biggest Fortnite collaborations of all time.

Fortnite has definitely levelled up their collaborations game over time, from just introducing skins, to introducing mythics and special abilities, and now designing their Island inspired by the collab. If Minecraft gets a similar treatment, we might see the Island adopt Minecraft’s unique art style. We could also see skins like Steve and other items make it into the game. However, this is just speculation, and readers should take this information with a massive grain of salt.

In other news, another claim states that Fortnite could be collaborating with The Office. Additionally, here are the patch notes for the January 9 39.20 update. Do you think Fortnite’s Minecraft collaboration is in early development? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Disney Afternoon Collection receiving an ESRB rating for Nintendo Switch. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
